newsitem.title: CHINA: IBM's Lotus sees fast China revenue growth.
newsitem.headline: IBM's Lotus sees fast China revenue growth.

text.p: Lotus Development Corp, the software unit of International Business Machines Corp of the U.S., expects China sales to soar in 1997 but investment will exceed revenues, a company official said on Tuesday.
Lotus expected revenues next year to be 3.5 times as high as in 1996, said Jordan Pi, general manager of the company's wholly-owned Lotus Software China Ltd Corp.
The company would ensure investment in China continued to outweigh revenues, Pi said.
He declined to give details of either sales or investment, but said Lotus already enjoyed a strong market share in China.
"In communications products our market share is about 80 percent... in desktop products it's about 10 percent," he said.

While Lotus expected to expand its share of the Chinese desktop software market in 1997, new competition from Microsoft Corp could cause some weakening of Lotus's dominance in communications software, he said.

Microsoft last month launched a Chinese version of its messaging system software Exchange Server 4.0. The software provides direct access to the Internet, enabling corporate workgroups to share electronic mail, databases and documents.
Lotus had launched its Chinese-language communications software in 1994, Pi said.
The company would pursue bundling agreements with computer companies in the China market to boost sales of its desktop software, he said without giving details.
